publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3596 Dennis Canavan: Don't Attack Iraq-That the Parliament welcomes the decision to allow UN weapons inspectors into Iraq and believes that the Governments of the United Kingdom and the United States of America should now withdraw the threat of military action and increase diplomatic efforts to ensure peace and justice. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr John McAllion*, Tommy Sheridan*, Robin Harper*
S1M-3596 Don't Attack Iraq (lodged on 19 November 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3596# Don't Attack Iraq (lodged on 19 November 2002) Fiona McLeod*

S1M-3596# Dennis Canavan: Don't Attack Iraqâ€”That the Parliament welcomes the decision to allow UN weapons inspectors into Iraq and believes that the Governments of the United Kingdom and the United States of America should now withdraw the threat of military action and increase diplomatic efforts to ensure peace and justice. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr John McAllion, Tommy Sheridan, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Fiona McLeod, Christine Grahame*
S1M-3596# Don't Attack Iraq (lodged on 19 November 2002) Bill Butler*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3596# Don't Attack Iraq (lodged on 19 November 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3596# Don't Attack Iraq (lodged on 19 November 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3596# Don't Attack Iraq (lodged on 19 November 2002) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-3596# Don't Attack Iraq (lodged on 19 November 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*
